reviewText: Amazon's aspect ratio info is incorrect. These movies are not 1:85:1 (filling widescreen entirely) but rather the theatrical widescreen aspect (black bars top and bottom). Disappointing, but not a deal-breaker. The stories are not as compeling and the characters not as developed as other superhero movies (e.g. Spiderman and Ironman) but they are still a lot of fun, especially for longtime FF fans. And the blu-ray is stunning!

Title: Fantastic Four Collection: (Fantastic Four/ Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer)

reviewText: I really hoped this movie would resemble theX-Men Trilogy (X-Men/ X2 - X-Men United/ X-Men - The Last Stand), which I thought was a model of how to transform a comic book into a movie.Unfortunately,Fantastic Fourfalls a bit flat. That casting is part of the problem. I thought Chris Evans was funny as Johnny "Torch." However, Jessica Alba as a scientist? I'm sorry, that's just casting so against type that it doesn't work. There's also no plot or emotional depth. The film tries to add some morality with Ben Grimm (Michael Chiklis), but it just seems superficial (an the silly orange costume doesn't help).The real problem is Julian McMahon as Victor Van Doom. I've always said a good movie needs a compelling villain. Van Doom's just a horrible, superficial villain. His only motive appears to be the lust for more power - so boring and cliche. He also has some of the corniest lines in the movie. For example, during the middle of the climatic fight scene, when zapping Jessica Alba with lightning, he says "Susan, you're fired!" That really breaks the mood and tension of the scene.It's probably worth watchingFantastic Fouronce if you like action movies, but this isn't a keeper.Overall,Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surferis better than its predecessor. The acting, effects, and plot are all a step up. The movie also has more memorable and emotionally poignant scenes (such as when Ben and Johnny sit in a bar discussing how they would spend their last minutes, Ben scaring the bear away...).I'm still not crazy as Julian McMahon as Van Doom - and he still says corny lines in the middle of battles - but he's not so central to this movie. On the other hand, the Silver Surfer makes for a much better villain - mysterious, cool, and powerful. I like the end - a bit ofThe Day the Earth Stood Still (Two-Disc Widescreen Edition).I still don't think it's quite as good as theX-Men Trilogy, butFantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surferis at least not quite as careless an effort.Just a note for concerned audiences: there are a few sexual innuendoes in the movies. They'll fly right over the head of most kids, but might be worth mentioning.

reviewText: I won't argue about comic-to-film translation. Expecting things to be exact from the comic book should be ideals left at the door. This is F4 the movie, you can read the comic book at your local comic store (I encourage you to do so!). F4 is a great movie if you can expect to have a good time with a comic book film, one that doesn't take itself too serious like the Dark Knight trilogy, nor overly comedic, like The Incredibles, but somewhere between. And I think that's the tone a Fantastic 4 film should take. While I enjoyed the first movie, I have to be honest, in the theater I was somewhat disappointed with its sequel. But over time I can sit down and enjoy it for what it is. I think time does that for some movies. Its OK to change and grow your opinions!The transfer to blu-ray disc is pleasing and fairly standard as far as transfer go, being just as vibrant as it was in the theater. These are mostly bright films, even when its dark outside. Surround sound is also pleasing enough, using a very sci-fi pallet of sounds. Extra's are on the poor side, ripping them (and the disc design) from the DVD's essentially, and I would say that brings the overall rating down to 3 stars but the fact this edition has both films I bumped it up to 4 (when I purchased the "Own the Moments" edition it was a steal being a few bucks over the price of just one film).Great movies if you can just stop being so critical, grab a big bowl of popcorn and your favorite soda, and have fun. I mean, this is fun for the whole family without alienating adults in my opinion. And since the Fantastic Four is one crazy family (maybe more than some families), its a win-win.

reviewText: I learned to read with Marvel comics.  Unlike the others in the series, such as X-Men or Spiderman, I thought these films rated about the same as the first Hulk:  flat, unable to conjure the rich emotional mix of unique and clearly developed characters, and far too dependent on special effects.  This is, of course, a matter of taste, but I simply couldn't suspend my disbelief enough to forget that I was watching something made up.  In this case, it felt derivative, the acting was OK but not solid or outstanding, and it didn't evoke a world that can live on in the imagination.  In a word, it didn't work for me.Not recommended.
summary: really awful, if you grew up reading this

reviewText: Short resumed Director Tim Story has done an excellent job with the film adaptation of the Marvel super-hero gang The Fantastic 4. He brought on a terrific cast, used some great special effects and made a couple of movies that the whole family can enjoy together.The criticism for the Fantastic 4 series seems to center around two similar objections. 1) Fans of the comic books are dissatisfied with the less intense film adaptations. And 2) The series is too light and family oriented. Indeed, those are valid objections if you've come looking for Marvel adaptations likeThe Blade Trilogy,DaredevilorThe Punisher. Even theSpider-Manand theX-Mentrilogies far exceed Fantastic 4 in adult-oriented content.The Fantastic 4 series holds up quite well as a family franchise. The stories are very well put together. There are funny moments and there's great action. The acting cast is good and they take their roles seriously. Sure, the movies get campy at times. But, c'mon...it's a 1960s comic book adaptation. But the modern twists and especially the modern special effects make these films thoroughly entertaining for young and old.Fun movies, and the sequel is even better than the original.
